reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Managing integrated TB/HIV response in Papua New Guinea

description.narrative: Papua New Guinea - TB/HIV - World Vision (PNG) Trust - WV Papua New Guinea. This program has the following goals: Estimated TB prevalence rate reduced from the current level of 541 per 100,000 population in 2012 to 339 per 100,000 population by 2020. Estimated TB mortality rate reduced from 54 per 100,000 population per year in 2012 to 30 per 100,000 population per year by 2020. A successful response to STIs and HIV that is driven by accurate and up-to-date strategic information and research. Decreased STI and HIV transmission and improved health and well-being of PLHIV. An environment that is safe and supportive of people’s efforts to remain healthy. An efficiently managed, capable and well-resourced national, provincial and district response to STIs and HIV. The objectives of this program are: Strengthen the implementation of local/PNG TB care and prevention strategy to increase (a) the case notification rate for bacteriologically- confirmed, new and relapse cases, from 43 in 2013 to 93 per 100,000 population in 2020 and (b) the treatment success rate of bacteriologically - confirmed new TB cases from 68 percent in 2012 to 88% in 2020. Improve the programmatic management of drug resistant TB in all the provinces focusing on high prevalent provinces: Western, NCD, Morobe, and Madang by increasing (a) the percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving drug susceptibility testing (DST) from 16 percent in 2013 to 96 percent in 2020 and (b) the treatment success rate for MDR-TB from 14 percent in 2011 to 60 percent in 2020. Increase the coverage of HIV testing of TB patients from <25 percent in 2013 to >90 percent in 2020 in all provinces, focusing on 10 high HIV burden provinces, by strengthening the HIV/TB collaborative activities. 70% of PLHIV know their status by 2020. 70% of PLHIV are accessing antiretroviral therapy by 2020. 90% of PLHIV on ART have a suppressed viral load within 12 months of commencing ART by 2020. Contribute in ensuring uninterrupted supply of drugs and medical products for Malaria,TB and HIV programmes through effective operationalization of mSupply, a Logistics Management Information System (LMIS), among existing and expansion sites in 2017 and 2020 respectively.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for PNG-C-WV
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART, who have a suppressed viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of confirmed RR/MDR-TB cases tested for resistance to second-line drugs
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Outcome indicator for PNG-C-WV
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Impact indicator for PNG-C-WV
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Percentage of people living with HIV
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
